page.title: 11Pevensey Bay Sorting Office
page.content: In the centre of Pevensey Bay is a small postal{sorting office }that has been in use for the last 5 years.There are 8{postmen and women}and supervisor working everyday except Sundays from 5am to 1pm.They deal with about 3000 letters and parcels a day.They sort for their own roads when the bags arrive from {Brighton,}and deliver over an area from Eastbourne to Norman's Bay and inland to Pevensey and Hankham.If envelopes or wrappings are torn and cannot be delivered they are put in a special bag and returned to the sender or "killed off".The busiest times are Wednesdays and Christmas. There are two deliveries, morning and afternoon,the pillar boxes are emptied during their rounds. In some areas birds' nests and litter have been found in them. The postmen walk or use bicycles.
